sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has two parallel sides of 10 cm and 14 cm, and two non-parallel sides of 8 cm and 12 cm. Find the perimeter of the trapezium.
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply need to add the lengths of all four sides together.

Perimeter = (side 1) + (side 2) + (side 3) + (side 4)
Perimeter = (10 cm) + (14 cm) + (8 cm) + (12 cm)
Perimeter = 44 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 44 cm.
